title: Maceo & All The King's Men - Doing Their Own Thing@320
description:
Recorded and released after a mutiny by most of James Brown&#039;s late-&#039;60s band, 
Doing Their Own Thing contains 12 slabs of superb early-&#039;70s style funk. 
Mostly instrumental, radio play for the album and subsequent singles appears to have been blocked by Brown himself. (Credited to Maceo Parker.) (AMG)


1   Maceo (7:47) 
2   Got To Getcha (2:49) 
3   Southwick (3:29) 
4   Funky Women (5:42) 
5   Shake It Baby (Keep On Shakin&#039; It) (2:12) 
6   Better Half (4:55) 
7   Don&#039;t Waste This World Away (6:19)     Vocals - Richard Griffith 
8   Mag-Poo (3:20) 
9   (I Remember) Mr. Banks (5:29) 
10   Thank You For Letting Me Be Myself Again (6:17)     Written-By - Sly Stone


Bass - Bernard Odum 
Drums - Melvin Parker 
Guitar - Alfonzo Kellum , Jimmy Nolen 
Saxophone [Alto, Tenor] - Maceo Parker 
Saxophone [Tenor] - Eldee Williams 
Trumpet - Richard Griffith 
Vocals - Maceo Parker (tracks: 2, 4, 5, 10) 

Written-By - Maceo & All The King&#039;s Men (tracks: 1 to 9) 
Producer - B.B. Cunningham , Ray Riley
Recorded at Sounds Of Memphis Studio Inc, except for track 10 recorded in NYC
Originally released in 1970
